labels.analysis: The MCP Server enables interaction with GrowthBook's feature management platform, allowing users to manage feature flags, experiments, SDK connections, and environments. It provides tools for searching documentation and performing operations like creating feature flags or SDK connections, integrating directly with development workflows. This is primarily a tool for software development teams managing feature releases and A/B experiments through GrowthBook's API.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around managing experiments, feature flags, and SDK connections, which falls under development tools. Secondary relevance to API integration is noted due to the server's interaction with GrowthBook's API. No custom labeling is needed as the predefined categories accurately capture its purpose.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: GrowthBook Server
server_info_crawled.author: @growthbook/growthbook-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Interact with GrowthBook directly from your LLM client to manage feature flags, experiments, environments, projects, and SDK connections. Search GrowthBook documentation and perform operations like creating feature flags or SDK connections seamlessly. Enhance your development workflow by integrating GrowthBook capabilities into your tools.

tools.name: get_environments
tools.description: Deploy Server GrowthBook Server Claim Server @growthbook/growthbook-mcp Try in Playground get_environments

tools.name: get_projects
tools.description: Fetches all projects from the GrowthBook API

tools.name: get_sdk_connections
tools.description: Get all SDK connections, which are how GrowthBook connects to an app. Importantly, users need the key, which is a public client key that allows the app to fetch features and experiments the API

tools.name: create_sdk_connection
tools.description: Create an SDK connection for a user. Returns an SDK clientKey that can be used to fetch features and experiments.

tools.name: create_feature_flag
tools.description: Create, add, or wrap an element with a feature flag. Add Item

tools.name: get_feature_flags
tools.description: Fetches all feature flags from the GrowthBook API. Flags are returned in the order they were created, from oldest to newest.

tools.name: get_single_feature_flag
tools.description: Fetches a specific feature flag from the GrowthBook API

tools.name: get_stale_safe_rollouts
tools.description: Fetches all complete safe rollouts (rolled-back or released) from the GrowthBook API

tools.name: get_experiments
tools.description: Fetches all experiments from the GrowthBook API

tools.name: create_force_rule
tools.description: Create a new force rule on an existing feature. If the existing feature isn't apparent, create a new feature using create_feature_flag first. A force rule sets a feature to a specific value for a specific environment based on a condition. For A/B tests and experiments, use create_experiment instead.

tools.name: get_experiment
tools.description: Gets a single experiment from GrowthBook

tools.name: search_growthbook_docs
tools.description: Search the GrowthBook docs on how to use a feature

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@growthbook/growthbook-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
